notesStmt.note: Dirt along edges and slight tidemark near outer end.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 40; ruled lines: 13; written lines: 13; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible pricking. Hair side and flesh side of membranes distinguishable. Three tagin on שעטנזגץ and ס, and one on בדהחיק. The letter ח arched sometimes, and occasionally בהםסרת at the end of a line. The letter ע flourished in the last word of the Megillah. No majuscular or minuscular letters. The names of the sons of Haman arranged in 6 lines. Ivory roller (150mm high). The first and part of the second membrane lined with green silk.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 15th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Presented to the British Museum by David Israel Brandon on 11 May 1822: inscribed on the verso.
